docs.text: " spice world " is just one long promotional film for the british girl band the spice girls .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sure there's a hint of humor in there every once in a while .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: actually , there's a couple of pretty good jabs at the spice girls .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but overall , who cares ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: not me .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if you don't know by now , the spice girls sing songs of love and friendship and responsibility and girl power , yet dress like streetwalkers from a lower middle class neighborhood .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in " spice world " they ride around in their big tour bus , whining about having to do photo shoots and give interviews .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: amazingly , all the talk they do about keeping commitments and upholding responsibilities only really applies to fun things , things they want to do , not things they are required to do to keep earning money .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and they keep babbling about " girl power " when they should really be talking about " cleavage power " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i mean , if all it takes is girl power , then why are they only one thread away from bursting out of their skimpy outfits ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film is pg , but really with only some very minor dialogue changes and scene extentions , you'd have yourself one raunchy adult film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: by the way , there's something in the opening credits which says " based on an idea by the spice girls " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: wow , they got idea credit !
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i certainly wish that was a new trend in hollywood . . .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: giving credit for simply having the thought " say girls , let's make a movie ! "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the supporting cast fares well .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: roger moore ( the real james bond ) mockingly plays the cliche-spewing " chief " of the spice girls , and darn it all , he's fun to watch .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: mark mckenney also is good as a screenwriter trying to pitch film ideas to the band's manager ( richard e . grant ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: one question though : george wendt ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you'd think that " spice world " would envoke one of two reactions in people .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if you like the spice girls , you'll like them even more afterwards .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and if you can't stand them ( like me ) , then " spice world " will really make you sick .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: oddly , the audience i saw the film with , roughly 50 twelve year-old girls , sat in silence for the entire film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: well , not the two who sat directly behind me .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they kept muttering " this is stupid " over and over again .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: maybe there is hope for humanity after all .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: [pg]
docs.label: negative
